18.str2: (a) I remain, tarry, (b) I remain in, persist in. From epi and meno; to stay over, i.e. Remain.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

18.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
18.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Fifteen. From deka and pente; ten and five, i.e. Fifteen.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

19.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

19.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
19.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
20.str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

20.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
20.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: To deceive, lie, speak falsely. Middle voice of an apparently primary verb; to utter an untruth or attempt to deceive by falsehood.

21.str2: Then, thereafter, afterwards. From epi and eita; thereafter.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular

21.str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A small geographical division, district, or territory. From klino; a slope, i.e. a 'clime' or tract of country.
Syria, a great Roman imperial province, united with Cilicia. Probably of Hebrew origin; Syria, a region of Asia.
Probably of foreign origin; Cilicia, a region of Asia Minor.

22.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
22.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.

22.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
22.str2: To do not know, be ignorant of, sometimes with the idea of willful ignorance.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of ek and a derivative of kaleo; a calling out, i.e. a popular meeting, especially a religious congregation.
Judea, a Roman province, capital Jerusalem. Feminine of Ioudaios; the Judaean land, a region of Palestine.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

23.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
23.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Alone, but, only. Neuter of monos as adverb; merely.

23.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
23.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
At one time or other, at some time, formerly. From the base of pou and te; indefinite adverb, at some time, ever.

23.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
23.str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
23.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

23.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
At one time or other, at some time, formerly. From the base of pou and te; indefinite adverb, at some time, ever.

23.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
23.str2: To lay waste, destroy, ravage, harass. Prolongation from pertho; to ravage.

24.parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
24.str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
24.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
